author: wsjcom
title: Flight of Connecticut High Earners Hurts Income Rate
text:
You point out in “The Regressive State of America” (Review & Outlook, April 26) that personal-income growth in Connecticut has been among the lowest of the 50 states since 2012. I agree increased state income and sales taxes have been a contributing factor.
Due to technology our most affluent citizens may now live wherever they wish, yet still manage their wealth or business from a location distant to Wall Street. They have moved to states with no or lower income taxes. Some still have a home in Connecticut but moved...
